page.title: 08JOBS FOR THE GIRLS
page.content: In the summer of 1985 the West Suffolk Federation of Womens Institutes set its members a competition "Here is a fiver make it go forth and multiply". Chevington W.I.'s idea was a variation on 'Bob-a-Job' charging a little more than a bob, anything legal, feasible and in good taste was considered. We undertook gardening (oh the stinging nettles and my aching back), knitting, housework, car washing, cake baking, flower arranging, feeding a cat, jam making, washing-up and waitressing. We raised over 190 pounds (10% of which we were allowed to keep for our own funds) towards the cost of repairs to our Head Quarters in Whiting Street, Bury St. Edmunds. We won the prize, a clock, for the best idea.
